result.title: KPS CAPITAL PARTNERS TO ACQUIRE CONTROLLING STAKE IN KETJEN FROM ALBEMARLE
result.text: NEW COMPANY WILL BE A GLOBAL LEADER IN ADVANCED CATALYSTS AND ADDITIVES FOR THE REFINING AND PETROCHEMICAL INDUSTRIES NEW YORK , Oct. 27, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- KPS Capital Partners, LP ("KPS") announced today that, through a newly formed affiliate, it has entered into a definitive agreement with Albemarle Corporation ("Albemarle") (NYSE: ALB) to acquire a controlling stake in Ketjen Corporation's refining catalyst solutions business (collectively, "Ketjen" or the "Company"). KPS and Albemarle, through affiliates, will own approximately 51% and 49% of Ketjen at close, respectively, with KPS having a majority of the Board of Directors and operational control of Ketjen.

result.title: Albemarle Corporation DEP SHS REPSTG A: Mandatory Converts, Not Traditional Preferred Shares
result.text: Despite the "preferred shares" naming convention and a fixed coupon (7.25% on a $50 liquidation preference), ALB.PR.A is a Mandatory Convertible Security that must convert into Albemarle (ALB) common stock. The conversion ratio of ALB.PR.A is variable and based on three price tiers for the common stock. Albemarle issued ALB.PR.A to optimize its balance sheet. The structure allowed the company to raise approximately $2.3 billion in capital by classifying the funds as equity (improving debt ratios).
